The world is facing the challenge of the pandemic caused by the novel coronavirus, SARS‐CoV‐2, which results in a disease syndrome known as Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID‐19). This disease started as an outbreak in Wuhan, China in December 2019 and at May 23, 2020, the virus had spread to 216 countries, areas and territories across the world with 5 103 006 confirmed cases and 333 401 deaths.
1 On March 11, 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the disease a global pandemic.
